data.title: Good, but seemed expensive for what we got!
data.text: We enjoyed our frozen custard w/ a couple items mixed in to them.  They were tasty, but when we looked at what we paid for what we got, just not to sure that we'll go back.  Also, they had what looked to be plenty of help, but it took 10 mins. to get our two items.

data.title: Rather unimpressive
data.text:
Wife and I went to Neilsen's out of curiosity this evening.  My wife ordered the hot dog meal and I ordered the pastrami grinder meal. It was a poor experience, and we will not be returning for the following reasons:

1. The food was mediocre. My wife's hot dog was cooked ok (at least it wasn't cold!) with a toasted bun, but she was given the most laughably small portions of condiments I have ever seen.  She had asked for onions and relish, and the hot dog came out with less than half a teaspoon of relish, and two of the thinnest, saddest looking slivers of onion I have ever seen.  I could hardly contain myself from laughing at the look on her face. As for my pastrami grinder, it was OK, but nothing special.  Something I could whip up half asleep at 3 o'clock in the morning, and I am not a good cook (and we don't have any pastrami in the house).

2. The price was high given the above quality.  Not sure if they are driving up the price to compensate for a lack of business, but we felt the price was excessive for the aforementioned quality issues.

3. The wait was long. I don't know what they were doing to prepare the food, but it seriously took over 15 minutes, and we were the only people in the restaurant at the time.

4. The workers didn't really seem to care.  They weren't rude or anything, but the vibe was definitely, "please let this shift be over soon."  In addition, there were no paper towels stocked in the bathroom, and they ran out of napkins (we grabbed the last two).

Overall, this review may seem a bit harsh, but they really are going to need to make some changes to survive.

data.title: Frozen Custard is Awesome!
data.text: I had never tried frozen custard before, but I had a coupon for a free cone. I took my granddaughter and got a chocolate frozen custard cone for each of us. It was really good. I have since gone back and tried the raspberry and vanilla each just as awesome!

data.title: Great Custard- Ridiculously Slow Drive Thru
data.text: We were here on a Saturday night and it was busy so we decided to do the drive thru. It took almost 30 minutes to get a cup of custard with brownies on top. We have been here before and it wasn't as slow and crowded and the service was quicker. But I won't be going back soon until they figure out how to work more efficient!

data.title: yummy
data.text: Tasty.Very creamy, but not overly sweet I like that they cones that they put their custard in. I like the chocolate chip mint.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: This is a special treat, once or twice a year, but I was sorry I went this time. Soft and melting concrete and the workers were already taking apart the machines and cleaning with more than hour before closing on a Saturday night.

data.title: Not sure what the hype is all about.
data.text: Expensive, mine was mediocre and my wife threw hers away. Originally went because of the great reviews and was curious. But it didn't live up to the hype.

data.title: Awesome frozen treat!
data.text: We have always gone here for dessert and it has never let us down!  I love to get the mix-ins with peanut butter cups, I just wish that they had coffee flavor ice cream....

data.title: Taste Treat
data.text: If your in the area an have a sweet tooth ,make sure you stop by.Never had before but will drop in next time in town.

data.title: best concete
data.text: for a special treat i always get the caramel cashew concrete. This ice cream like treat melts in  your mouth and then you get to crunch on some cashews. WOW!!!

data.title: The Concrete is the bomb
data.text: Don't waste your time with anything else and go straight for the good stuff. I have NEVER had a bad batch of Concrete...it is the smoothest, creamiest, best tasting custard you can get anywhere around the Wasatch Front.  MmMMmmm

data.title: Great frozen custard!  Try the chocolate concrete with almonds!  Or Caramel Cashew
data.text: Great frozen custard!  Try the chocolate concrete with almonds!  Or Caramel Cashew

data.title: This ice cream and burger joint has German ties and is uber-yummy.  The frozen custard is a creamy frozen delight that...
data.text: This ice cream and burger joint has German ties and is uber-yummy.  The frozen custard is a creamy frozen delight that must be tasted.

data.title: I haven't been to this exact location but other Neilsen's have been awesome! I need to go get me some!
data.text: I haven't been to this exact location but other Neilsen's have been awesome! I need to go get me some!
